title: There's a noise in my Yamaha HS5 monitors. I've been told by the guys in the store I bought them from that it's because my Focusrite Scarlett Solo has 'unbalanced' outputs and I should get the 2i2. Is that true? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanx everybody for the answers. Just to update you on what it turned out to be… …the answer is (as you may expect) quite stupid. After trying almost everything, it turned out that the reason for the noise is the fact that one of the monitor-powering AC cables was partially broken/something interrupted or not giving a good connection inside of it (the way it came out of the box, actually) but how could I’ve known…:)

It’s possible that it is true… but first check the debugging hints from all the other answers. I have a Focusrite 18i6 with balanced outputs, and it is completely silent with my monitors using balanced cables, but is not with unbalanced cables… so, this easily could be your problem. But then, because I have a balanced setup, I haven’t been as careful as possible to make sure that the grounds are perfect, etc.
